2014.title: Metchosin Equestrian Society Riding Ring Upgrade Project
details: Once again the IEOA has completed another very successful community project.  Thank you to the following companies who helped with this project.  Your support helped the residents of Pearce Crescent, and the surrounding area, develop a play area for children to exercise and socialize in a safe, fun and friendly environment.

Over the years IEOA members have completed numerous volunteer projects.  The IEOA gives us the opportunity to introduce ourselves to the community, and through our donated projects, return a benefit to the local area in which we live and work.

2015.title: Central Middle School Naturalized Playspace Project
details: Once again the Island Equipment Owners Association (IEOA) has completed another very successful community project on August 8, 2015 with the excavation and berm work for the naturalized playspace at Central Middle School. Central Middle School is very grateful for the time, expertise and equipment that was donated for this project. This project has been endorsed by School District 61 and is supported by a partnership between the Ministry of Health and Ministry of Education - due to the correlation between health and achievement. This project creates a space that will allow for stress reduction, unstructured and passive play and for age appropriate social gathering.

2016.title: Victoria Motorcycle Club
details: On Saturday October 22, 2016 the Island Equipment Owners Association (IEOA) converged on the Victoria Motorcycle Club property in Metchosin for the day. The service road was re-graded and a proper ditch created to help provide better access for emergency vehicles and patrons. The parking lot was expanded and graded with fresh roadbases added and rolled to create a much improved surface for everyone who uses the club.

2016b.title: Peninsula Soccer Association Parking Lot Improvement Project
details: On Saturday August 27, 2016 the Island Equipment Owners Association (IEOA) gathered at the Peninsula Soccer Association parking lot at Blue Heron Park in North Saanich for the day. The gravel driveway and parking lots were graded and rolled and new RAP was added to create a much improved surface for the hundreds of families that use the soccer fields. The nonprofit organization is very grateful for the time, expertise and equipment that was donated for this project and pleased with the way it all turned out.

donators: Northridge Equipment - Tracie Cownden and Mike Cownden
Howcon Underground - Stuart Howarth and helpers
Jacob Bros - Jason Jacob and Trevor Tremblay
Jacob Bros - Jason Jacob and Trevor Tremblay
Allterra and South Island Resource Mgmt - Ray Lam and Shawna Ashbee
Basic Rock Products - Andy Mackin and Sean Gibbs

2019.title: BC SPCA Wild Animal Rehabilitation Centre (Wild ARC) Project
details: On Monday December 30, 2019 the Island Equipment Owners Association (IEOA) project coordinators and volunteers gathered at the Wild ARC property on Malloch Road in Metchosin for the day. The drive way into the animal recovery centre was upgraded by widening it and covering it with fresh roadbase and finishing with a roller for compaction. A proper parking area was created to help provide more parking for the many volunteer and clinic administration vehicles who attend to the wounded animals everyday as well as the public bringing supplies as well as animals in need of care.

donators: NAN Site Servicing Ltd. - Nirmal Johal
Canadian Utility Construction Corp - Chris Putney
